meanings.definition: The process of growing old or maturing.
meanings.sent1: The agings of a tree can be seen in its rings.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the agings in her grandparents' faces.
meanings.sent3: The agings of the cheese made it taste stronger.
meanings.sent4: Time's agings on the building gave it a sense of history.
meanings.sent5: The agings of the wine enhanced its flavor.

meanings.definition: The act of causing something to appear older or more mature.
meanings.sent1: The costume designer used clever techniques to create realistic agings on the actor's clothes.
meanings.sent2: The artist applied paint to achieve the desired agings on the canvas.
meanings.sent3: The agings on the fake ID fooled the bouncer at the club.
meanings.sent4: The antique dealer specialized in creating artificial agings on furniture.
meanings.sent5: The makeup artist skillfully added agings to the actor's face for the role.

meanings.definition: The changes that occur in a material or substance over time.
meanings.sent1: The agings of the metal caused it to rust.
meanings.sent2: The agings of the paper made it yellow and brittle.
meanings.sent3: The agings of the fruit turned it into a delicious jam.
meanings.sent4: The agings of the leather gave it a weathered look.
meanings.sent5: The agings of the fabric altered its texture over time.
